title: Evaluation & Sign-Off — Overview
objective: Understand what sign-off means and how you’ll be evaluated before working solo shifts.

blocks.label: Purpose
blocks.text: Sign-off protects the guest experience and sets you up for success. It’s not about perfection — it’s about readiness.

blocks.title: What Sign-Off Confirms
bullets: You can run a section with calm control
You ring accurately in the POS
You communicate effectively with the team
You handle problems appropriately (and escalate when needed)

title: Shadow Shift Expectations
objective: Know what’s expected during shadowing and trainer/manager observation shifts.

blocks.title: What You Should Do
bullets: Arrive early and prepared (uniform, tools, notebook if used)
Ask questions early (don’t wait for a mistake)
Take ownership of your tables as assigned
Stay calm and professional even when busy

blocks.label: Mindset
blocks.text: Shadow shifts are about learning and consistency — not showing off.

title: Evaluation Criteria (What We Look For)
objective: Understand the core areas you’re evaluated on before sign-off.

blocks.title: The Core Categories
bullets: POS accuracy and clean ticket writing
Safety: allergies and responsible alcohol service

title: Observed Service Flow (What Good Looks Like)
objective: Know what “ready” looks like during a live evaluation shift.

blocks.title: Green Flags
bullets: Greets quickly and acknowledges tables even when busy
Controls pacing (courses don’t stack or stall)
Guests don’t have to chase you down

blocks.title: Red Flags
bullets: Overwhelmed body language or visible frustration

title: Observed POS Accuracy (What Good Looks Like)
objective: Understand what clean, accurate POS performance looks like during evaluation.

blocks.title: Green Flags
bullets: Rings items correctly the first time
Uses modifiers instead of long notes
Seat numbers used when needed (splits, large parties)

blocks.title: Red Flags
bullets: Frequent re-fires due to ringing errors

title: Observed Guest Issues (Recovery + Escalation)
objective: Demonstrate you can handle problems calmly and appropriately.

blocks.title: What We Want to See
bullets: Uses recovery steps: Listen → Apologize → Fix → Follow up
Escalates correctly (allergies, alcohol, aggressive guests, big comps)
Clear manager handoff (table, issue, what you did, what guest wants)

blocks.label: Standard
blocks.text: If something feels like it could become a bigger problem, you escalate early.

title: Standards Scorecard (Self-Check)
objective: Use a simple scorecard to evaluate your readiness and identify what to improve.

blocks.title: How to Use This
bullets: Pick ONE area to improve next shift
Ask your trainer/lead for one coaching point

blocks.text: Improvement is a skill. Great servers don’t avoid feedback — they use it.

title: Sign-Off Process (How Graduation Works)
objective: Know what happens after evaluation and what sign-off means operationally.

blocks.title: Typical Sign-Off Steps
bullets: Final coaching notes (1–3 key focus points)

blocks.title: If You’re Not Ready Yet
bullets: You’ll get a clear plan (not vague criticism)
You’ll repeat targeted reps (POS accuracy, pacing, checkbacks, etc.)

blocks.label: Reminder
blocks.text: Not passing on the first try is normal. The goal is confidence and consistency.

title: Evaluation & Sign-Off Check
objective: Confirm you understand what’s evaluated and how to approach sign-off shifts.

options: You can consistently meet standards and run a section safely
questions.explanation: Sign-off is about consistent readiness and safety — not perfection.

questions.prompt: What’s a major red flag during evaluation?
options: Missing checkbacks and not communicating delays
questions.explanation: Guests losing trust usually comes from missing timing and communication.

questions.prompt: Which situations require early manager involvement?
options: Allergy concerns or alcohol over-service risk
questions.explanation: Allergies and alcohol issues are safety and liability priorities.

questions.prompt: How should you respond if you’re not signed off yet?
options: Take it personally and stop asking questions
Ask for clear focus points and work targeted reps
questions.explanation: Targeted reps + feedback are how you improve quickly and earn sign-off.
